required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Pharmacokinetic Profile of Nanoemulsion CBD
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Pharmacokinetic Profile of Nanoemulsion CBD

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the current study is to evaluate the bioavaibiltiy of nanoemulsion CBD in normal healthy Individuals. This is an open cross-over design study in healthy individuals to assess the safety and pharmacokinetic (PK) effects of nanoemulsion cannabidiol.

detailed_description.textblock:
The goal of this study is to determine the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamic profile of CBD in normal healthy individuals under standard and high fat fed conditions.
CBD has recently gained significant attention as a potential treatment for various disorders. One aspect for consideration in the development of CBD medication in capsule form is the poor bioavailability of cannabinoids such as CBD to obtain clinically effective doses since only ~4-6% of CBD is absorbed orally. This study will investigate the potential of CBD in a nanoemulsion formulation in a capsule to enhance bioavailability, reduce the incidence of gastrointestinal side effects, reduce first pass metabolism and enhance onset time. This PK study will be conducted with standard meal and high fat conditions in normal healthy volunteers in a cross-over design, separated by a washout period of 1 week. Healthy volunteers are defined as having no significant health-related issues (i.e., the absence of significant medical, psychosocial, or emotional conditions) that are verified by clinical and psychiatric assessments.
The study will first evaluate in healthy volunteers the PK, tolerability and safety profiles of a new CBD formulation designed to improve bioavailability.
Test conditions and order:
1. 200 mg CBD nanoemulsion (standard meal)
2. 400 mg CBD nanoemulsion (standard meal)
3. 400 mg Epidiolex (standard meal)
4. 400 mg CBD nanoemulsion (high fat meal)
Blood samples will be taken at -60,15, 30, 45 and 60 min and 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 hours associated with administration of the CBD capsules.
Monitoring period for PK: 24 hours (plasma and urine PK). Participation in 4 test conditions for a duration of approximately 4 weeks and a 1 week follow-up assessment. Total length of in-house stay is 12 hours, with participants returning the following day for 24 hour time point procedures.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is an open cross-over design study in healthy individuals to confirm the safety and pharmacokinetic (PK) effects of nanoemulsion cannabidiol.

primary_outcome.description: Safety and adverse effects will be assessed with the Systematic Assessment for Treatment Emergent Events (SAFTEE).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time point -60,15, 30, 45 and 60 minutes and 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 hours associated with administration of the CBD capsules.
primary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration of CBD and its metabolites

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time point -60,15, 30, 45 and 60 minutes and 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 hours associated with administration of the CBD capsules.
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time point -60 minutes and 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24 hours associated with administration of the CBD capsules.
secondary_outcome.description: Peak urinary excretion of CBD and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the urine concentration curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time point -60 minutes and 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24 hours associated with administration of the CBD capsules.
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the urine concentration versus time curve

arm_group.description: Nanoemulsion Cannabidiol 200 mg with standard meal
Nanoemulsion Cannabidiol 400 mg with standard meal
Nanoemulsion Cannabidiol 400 mg with high fat meal

overall_official.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

facility.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
